post_text:
Message regarding the July 22nd NJUHSD Board of Trustees Public Meeting

The district is unable to conduct public comment for its July 22 special meeting in both in-person and virtual formats. Public comment will be conducted via Zoom as posted on the board's agenda. The district was unable to secure a room / facility that could safely accommodate members of the public and meet current Nevada County Public Health Department social distancing guidelines. Both the Nevada Union and Bear River campuses are undergoing previously scheduled construction and upgrades. Venues on both campuses that would be potentially large enough to accommodate the public and meet public health guidelines were not available.
text:

The district was unable to secure a room / facility that could safely accommodate members of the public and meet current Nevada County Public Health Department social distancing guidelines. Both the Nevada Union and Bear River campuses are undergoing previously scheduled construction and upgrades. Venues on both campuses that would be potentially large enough to accommodate the public and meet public health guidelines were not available.

We will monitor the situation closely and stay in communication with families and staff for the days ahead. Please be safe.‬
text: ‪NJUHSD Families and Community - we hope you had a restful fall break. Due to the PG&E power shut off, all NJUHSD schools will be closed tomorrow, Monday, October 28. We will monitor the situation closely and stay in communication with families and staff for the days ahead. Please be safe.‬

post_text:
Good Evening NJUHSD Families and Staff,

Due to uncertainty surrounding the restoration of power, and the timing of such, all district high schools will be closed, tomorrow, October 10th.

The safety and well being of our students and staff is paramount. We understand that PG&E is in the process of restoring power in our area but it is unlikely that we will be fully powered by tomorrow morning. Given the logistics of powering up our technology, food services, and other related services, we are erring on the side of safety for all district and surrounding schools, and closing school tomorrow.

Thank you

Given the logistics of powering up our technology, food services, and other related services, we are erring on the side of safety for all district and surrounding schools, and closing school tomorrow.

Thank you

post_text: Due to a regionwide PG&E power outage, all of our schools in the Nevada Joint Union High School District have been closed. The safety and well being of our students and staff are paramount. We will keep families and staff posted by 8 pm tonight about operations tomorrow. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

post_text: Have you ever considered the amazing and satisfying field of education? NJUHSD is looking for teachers who want to make a difference! Do you have a Bachelor's degree? Have you worked with kids before? You may be able to qualify for a Provisional Internship Permit that could let you begin teaching in the fall while you complete your California Teaching Credential requirements. Go on-line to www.edjoin.org, see our job openings and apply! If you have any questions please contact Louise Johnson or Lesa St. Germain in the district office. Please like and share this post and consider joining our amazing team!

post_text:
This is Superintendent Louise Johnson with an important message to the entire Nevada Joint Union High School District Community. We offer congratulations and sincere best wishes to all of our graduates of the Class of 2018. We wish all a safe and happy summer break. School will begin again on Wednesday, August 15, 2018.

As many of you know I will be retiring after 34 years in education near the end of July. Please join me in welcoming your new superintendent, Brett McFadden to our wonderful community.

Every day, you have all made me very proud to be your Superintendent. Thank you!
text:
This is Superintendent Louise Johnson with an important message to the entire Nevada Joint Union High School District Community. We offer congratulations and sincere best wishes to all of our graduates of the Class of 2018. We wish all a safe and happy summer break. School will begin again on Wednesday, August 15, 2018.

As many of you know I will be retiring after 34 years in education near the end of July. Please join me in welcoming your new superintendent, Brett McFadden to our wonderful community.

Every day, you have all made me very proud to be your Superintendent. Thank you!

post_text:
Good Afternoon,

This is Superintendent Louise Johnson wishing all of our students and families a safe and happy Spring Break. We will return to school on Monday, April 2, 2018 for the 4th Quarter. In June, we will be delighted to launch our Class of 2018 into their lives.

We also want to let you know that beginning on Monday, March 26 we will begin construction for the underground utility and paving project at Nevada Union, the track at Bear River and the fire alarm system at Bear River. Construction will be fenced and the contractors will comply with local noise ordinances. Please take care to follow alternative routes that will be posted on our campuses as we move into the next phase of our Measure B construction.

Thank you Nevada County voters! We’ll see everyone back at school in April. Have a great break!
text:
Good Afternoon,

This is Superintendent Louise Johnson wishing all of our students and families a safe and happy Spring Break. We will return to school on Monday, April 2, 2018 for the 4th Quarter. In June, we will be delighted to launch our Class of 2018 into their lives.

We also want to let you know that beginning on Monday, March 26 we will begin construction for the underground utility and paving project at Nevada Union, the track at Bear River and the fire alarm system at Bear River. Construction will be fenced and the contractors will comply with local noise ordinances. Please take care to follow alternative routes that will be posted on our campuses as we move into the next phase of our Measure B construction.

Thank you Nevada County voters! We’ll see everyone back at school in April. Have a great break!

Good Morning,
This is Superintendent Louise Johnson with an important message for the Nevada Joint Union High School District. Due to ongoing interruptions in transportation and continued evacuation of significant numbers of students and staff due to our local fires, all schools in the Nevada Joint Union High School District will be closed on Tuesday, October 10, 2017. We will continue to update you as more information becomes available. Stay safe and take care of your families.

We will continue to update you as more information becomes available. Stay safe and take care of your families.

post_text: This is Superintendent Louise Johnson with an important message for the Nevada Joint Union High School District. Due to transportation interruption and evacuations because of the Logo and McCourtney fires, all schools in the Nevada Joint Union High School District are closed today, October 9, 2017. We will update you as we know more. Be safe and take care of your families.

Due to transportation interruption and evacuations because of the Logo and McCourtney fires, all schools in the Nevada Joint Union High School District are closed today, October 9, 2017. We will update you as we know more. Be safe and take care of your families.

post_text: PG&E is replacing a power pole on Ridge Road on Monday, October 9 and we are expected to be without power from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. The district office is the only area of NU that will be affected. We will be bringing in a little generator to keep our phones going but will be without e-mail for the day. Please be aware of this condition as we will have a delayed response to any e-mail.

Please be aware of this condition as we will have a delayed response to any e-mail.

post_text:
Greetings NJUHSD Family,
As we approach the midpoint of February, this is a friendly reminder that February is our month for community engagement for our Local Control Accountability Plan and Budget Planning for the 2017-18 school year. We held two of our annual 4 town hall meetings around the county at Bear River on Monday, January 30 and Penn Valley on Monday, February 6. Out two upcoming meetings are in the MPR at Nevada Union at 6:00 PM on Monday, February 13 and at the San Juan Ridge Family Resource center at 6:00 PM on Monday, February 27. At each meeting we are updating the community on our progress towards our LCAP and 2020 Vision goals and soliciting input for the next year. Each meeting is the same so come to the one that best fits your schedule are area of residence.

If you are unable to come to a meeting, please take 3 – 5 minutes to fill out our 2017 LCAP survey now! Here is the link: https://goo.gl/H0Ns4F

Thank you for your assistance in our planning for an awesome 2017-18 school year.

Sincerely,
Louise Johnson
Superintendent

post_text: The Board of Trustees of the Nevada Joint Union High School District is taking applications for an existing Board vacancy in Trustee Area 5. Applicants must live in Area 5 which is in the general area of South Nevada County. If interested, please verify with the Nevada County Elections Office that your address is within Trustee Area 5. Applications are available on our website, www.njuhsd.com, under “What's New?”. Applications are due to the District Office by 4:00 PM on Friday, January 13, 2017. Applicants will be publicly interviewed by the Board at a special Board meeting at 6:00 PM on Wednesday, January 25, 2017 in the Library at Nevada Union High School. Please call Debbie Zeisler at (530) 273-3351 if you have any questions.

More local career opportunities will be here to engage our community members interested in exploring a new career in the coming months.

post_text:
Greetings,
Nevada Union High School is considering new textbooks to align with the new California State Standards for Mathematics. Textbooks, along with the rationale for selection, are currently on display in the library at Nevada Union for public review and comment until March 18, 2016. If you would like to look at the materials, please report to the high school office to obtain a visitor pass and directions to the area of display. We look forward to working with our community as we continue in our efforts to provide all of our students with a world class, multifaceted educational experience.
Sincerely,
Nevada Union High School

post_text: The Board of Trustees of the Nevada Joint Union High School District is taking applications for an existing Board vacancy in Trustee Area 2. Applicants must live in Area 2 which is in the general area of downtown Grass Valley. If interested, please verify with the Nevada County Elections Office that your address is within Trustee Area 2. Applications are available on our website, www.njuhsd.com under “What's New?” and the Board of Trustees tab. Applications are due to the District Office by 4:00 PM on February 5, 2016. Applicants will be publically interviewed by the Board at the next regularly scheduled Board meeting at 6:00 PM on February 10, 2016 in the Science Lecture Hall at Nevada Union High School. Please call Donna Pencik at (530) 273-3351 if you have any questions.

post_text:
In light of yesterday’s tragic events occurring in Roseburg, Oregon; we offer our sincere condolences to those suffering the effects of that incident.

At this time, we would like to take this opportunity to encourage all parents to speak with their students about awareness of their surroundings and the importance of reporting any unusual or suspect circumstances. NJUHSD schools periodically receive reports and/or threats that may or may not be viable. Please be assured that any and all threats are treated with urgency and immediately reported to the appropriate law enforcement agency. Our policy and encouragement to staff and students is, “If you see something, say something”. The message applies to verbal, online, or social media interactions. All reports are quickly followed up on and passed on appropriately.

We are saddened by the events in Roseburg, Oregon. Rest assured that we are making every effort in our district to protect the students and staff on our of our school sites. Thank you for your attention to this important message and have a safe and fun weekend.

post_text:
On behalf of the Board of Trustees of the Nevada Joint Union High School District, we would like to invite everyone to a Town Hall Meeting scheduled for one week from today, Thursday, April 30, 2015 at 6:30 PM in the Multi-purpose room at Nevada Union High School. The purpose of this meeting is to collect further input from parents, students and the community regarding a possible change in school start time for the high school district from 7:30 AM to 8:30 AM.

In a recent parent survey, and at the regularly scheduled meeting of the Board of Trustees on April 8, 2015, there was support for both options. All opinions on both sides were well articulated and reasoned. There are many logistical concerns that we have been working on for many months, mostly ranging from the increased transportation costs for our district and some of our and elementary feeder districts to after school activities.

Please join us on April 30, at 6:30 PM in the NU cafeteria to contribute your voice to the discussion. I look forward to seeing you there.
text:
On behalf of the Board of Trustees of the Nevada Joint Union High School District, we would like to invite everyone to a Town Hall Meeting scheduled for one week from today, Thursday, April 30, 2015 at 6:30 PM in the Multi-purpose room at Nevada Union High School. The purpose of this meeting is to collect further input from parents, students and the community regarding a possible change in school start time for the high school district from 7:30 AM to 8:30 AM.

In a recent parent survey, and at the regularly scheduled meeting of the Board of Trustees on April 8, 2015, there was support for both options. All opinions on both sides were well articulated and reasoned. There are many logistical concerns that we have been working on for many months, mostly ranging from the increased transportation costs for our district and some of our and elementary feeder districts to after school activities.

Please join us on April 30, at 6:30 PM in the NU cafeteria to contribute your voice to the discussion. I look forward to seeing you there.

post_text: Good Afternoon and Happy Friday. This is Superintendent Louise Johnson with an important message for all of our 10th grade families. Next week on Tuesday, March 17 and Wednesday, March 18 all sophomores will be taking the California High School Exit Exam in English and Math. A passing score for a California diploma is 350 and a proficient score for the federal government is 380. The highest possible score is 450. Please help your student by assuring that he or she gets a good nights’ rest and adequate nutrition prior to the test. Specific information about testing times and schedules will come from your school. If you would like more information on the California High School Exit Exam it is available at http://www.cde.ca.gov/ta/tg/hs/. Thank you and GO SOPHOMORES, 380 is the goal!
shared_text:
CDE.CA.GOV
California High School Exit Examination (CAHSEE) - Testing (CA Dept of Education)

post_text:
We received information from Dan Frisella, Principal of Nevada Union High School today regarding suspicious activity yesterday, October 30 on Hughes Road in Grass Valley. A male Freshman high school student was walking to school when he was approached by a man in a red small-size pick-up truck. The man described as middle-aged offered the student a ride to school. The student refused and ran to school. The incident was reported to GVPD.
Parents are asked to remind students to be vigilant and aware of any suspicious activity. All suspicious activity should be reported to Law Enforcement. Let’s all be extra vigilant tonight for all of our children. Thank you for your attention.
text:
We received information from Dan Frisella, Principal of Nevada Union High School today regarding suspicious activity yesterday, October 30 on Hughes Road in Grass Valley. A male Freshman high school student was walking to school when he was approached by a man in a red small-size pick-up truck. The man described as middle-aged offered the student a ride to school. The student refused and ran to school. The incident was reported to GVPD.
Parents are asked to remind students to be vigilant and aware of any suspicious activity. All suspicious activity should be reported to Law Enforcement. Let’s all be extra vigilant tonight for all of our children. Thank you for your attention.

post_text: I am posting tonight to let all of our parents know that your student's first quarter report cards were sent out to your secure email address today. If you have shared your email address with us, you have received an email notification today that gives you a link to retrieve your student's report card. If you have not shared your email address with us you can see your student's report card in the Home Access Center. If you do not have e-mail or Internet, no worries, we will print and mail the report card to you. If you have any problems or concerns accessing the report card please contact our District Technology Help Desk at 530-272-9998 between 7 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. Thank you/

post_text: Bus 32, serving Bear River High School is being rerouted on Monday, September 15 due to the Dog Bar Fire. Any stops past Wolf Creek Road on Dog Bar will be picked up at Venus Court at 7:10 AM. The bus may be running slightly off schedule so please try to be at your stop about 5 minutes early. We are grateful to our fire fighters for their efforts in resolving this fire so that families could return to their homes so quickly. Thank you!

The bus may be running slightly off schedule so please try to be at your stop about 5 minutes early. We are grateful to our fire fighters for their efforts in resolving this fire so that families could return to their homes so quickly. Thank you!

post_text: The Nevada Joint Union High School District is taking applications for a Board vacancy in Trustee Area 5. Applicants must live in Area 5 which is in the south county including Alta Sierra, the Lime Kiln area, and south to the Bear River and Placer County line. Applications are available on our website under What's New and the Board of Trustees tab. Applications are due to the District Office by 4:00 PM on September 26, 2014. Applicants will be publically interviewed by the Board at the next regularly scheduled Board meeting on October 8, 2014 in the Science Lecture Hall at Nevada Union High School. Please call Donna Pencik at (530) 273-3351 if you have any questions.
